metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3962 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in ImageMagick where it did not properly sanitize certain input before using it to invoke convert processes. This flaw allows an attacker to create a specially crafted image that leads to a use-after-free vulnerability when processed by ImageMagick. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.x only').
